plugins.name: Variables to Xcode
plugins.description:
This plugin is used to export variables to Xcode color set.


### Usage


1. Run the plugin in Figma.

2. Select the color collection.

3. Click the export button.

4. unzip the file and copy the color set to your xcode project.
plugins.tagline: Export variables to Xcode color set

102618.name: Variables to Xcode
102618.description:
This plugin is used to export variables to Xcode color set.


### Usage


1. Run the plugin in Figma.

2. Select the color collection.

3. Click the export button.

4. unzip the file and copy the color set to your xcode project.
102618.release_notes: - Change the name to title case
102618.tagline: Export variables to Xcode color set

plugins.name: Color AutoUpdater
plugins.description:
🚀 Color AutoUpdater is your go-to Figma plugin for effortlessly keeping your design colors in check! Say goodbye to manually updating frame backgrounds and hello to automation.


✨ What it does:


🔍 Scans all frames on the current page for text nodes with valid hex color codes.

🎨 Updates frame backgrounds to match the detected hex color code.

🌓 Ensures text readability by switching text to white on dark backgrounds and black on light backgrounds.

🧼 Sets default colors (white background, black text) for frames without a color code, ensuring a clean and consistent look.


🛠️ How to use it:


Select the Page: Open your Figma file and navigate to the page you want to update.

Automatic Update: The plugin scans all frames on the page and updates background colors based on the hex codes found in text nodes.

Review Changes: Frames with valid hex codes will have their backgrounds updated and text colors adjusted. Frames without hex codes will have a default white background and black text.


⚠️ Relevant limitations:


The plugin supports only 6-character hex color codes (e.g., #FFFFFF).

It works on the current page only, so run it separately for each page in your Figma file.

Frames without color codes will be set to a white background and black text, which might override custom defaults set by the user.

💡 With Color AutoUpdater, maintain a polished and consistent design effortlessly, saving you time and ensuring color accuracy and readability. Try it now and elevate your design workflow! 🌟
plugins.tagline: update frame background colors based on color codes

plugins.name: Cluster Creator
plugins.description: Select a group of sticky notes or shapes with text, run the plugin, type in the text you want to grab the nodes by and click "create". The notes the contain the given text will be moved to a section with the same name as the given text. Now you can move that group of notes to wherever makes sense and rename the section if necessary.
plugins.tagline: Select sticky notes that contain your cluster key words

87984.name: Cluster Creator
87984.description: Select a group of sticky notes or shapes with text, run the plugin, type in the text you want to grab the nodes by and click "create". The notes the contain the given text will be moved to a section with the same name as the given text. Now you can move that group of notes to wherever makes sense and rename the section if necessary.
87984.release_notes: Account for sticky notes that are taller than the default sticky note height
87984.tagline: Select sticky notes that contain your cluster key words

plugins.name: Utopia Spacers
plugins.description:
The Utopia Spacers plugin uses the Utopia Fluid Space Calculator to generate a variable collection of number variables across a variety of comp size modes.


How to Use

  1. Visit Utopia.fyi and create a system of spacers using their fluid space calculator linked above.
  2. By default, spacers are only shown at their min and max size. To use this plugin, add one or more custom viewport sized by clicking the black + in the top right of the calculator's calculated values (see images).
  3. Once you're happy with your system, copy and paste the URL into the plugin. A new set of variables called "Utopia Spacers" will generate in your Local Variables.
  4. Use the spacers as normal variables. If you need to update values or add sizes, you can update the calculator and copy/paste the new, updated URL to bring in your changes.


Tips

  • Make sure the first viewport you enter is the size you'll be designing in (we use 1440px).
  • If you have a Starter Figma account, you're limited to only 1 mode. If you have a Professional or Organization level account you can use up to 4 modes. Enterprise accounts can use up to 40 modes.
  • We use 390px for mobile, 768 for tablet, 1440 for desktop, and 2560 for XL desktop.
  • Make sure to save your most-current Utopia URL somewhere so you can reference it easily.

accepted.name: Kylie LaCour
accepted.description: Enthusiast of elegant digital systems, dedicated advocate of fluid responsive design, and novice creator of plugins.

plugins.tagline: Generate a variable collection of fluid responsive spacers based on the Utopia.fyi design system.

plugins.name: Token Exporter
plugins.description:
Easily export your local variable collections from Figma into clean, developer-ready JSON files.

Perfect for sharing design tokens such as colors, spacing, typography, and more with developers.


✅ Supports multiple collections

✅ Converts collection names into safe, kebab-case JSON filenames

✅ Zips all exported files into a single downloadable .zip

✅ Compatible with both Design and Dev Mode
plugins.tagline: Share Tokens/Collection to the Developers in JSON format

plugins.name: Path Arrows
plugins.description:
Easily create clear visual connections between objects in your interface using arrows — fast, simple, and without any manual work. This plugin is perfect for showcasing screen transitions, button interactions, and other UI element relationships.


Here’s how it works:


1. Select the first object (the starting point of the arrow).

2. Then select the second object (the destination).

3. Choose the sides for connection (e.g., left to right or top to bottom).

4. Click the button — the plugin will automatically draw a clean arrow between the two.


It’s a quick and intuitive way to map out user flows, demonstrate interactions, or organize your layout visually


This is the MVP version — more updates are on the way. Your feedback means a lot!
plugins.tagline: Quickly connect screens, buttons, and elements with arrows to show how your interface works

plugins.name: Warp Zone
plugins.description: This plugin creates a 'Warp Zone' page in your document where you can store Figma objects you want to keep but don't need right now. Just select any frames, components, or other elements and run the plugin to warp them away. Each object remembers where it came from, so you can easily send them back to their original pages later by selecting them in the Warp Zone and running the plugin again.
plugins.tagline: Store and recall objects quickly and easily.

129345.name: Warp Zone
129345.description: This plugin creates a 'Warp Zone' page in your document where you can store Figma objects you want to keep but don't need right now. Just select any frames, components, or other elements and run the plugin to warp them away. Each object remembers where it came from, so you can easily send them back to their original pages later by selecting them in the Warp Zone and running the plugin again.
129345.tagline: Store and recall objects quickly and easily.

plugins.name: Rastarizer
plugins.description:
Rastarizer simplifies your workflow by converting Figma frames, components, and instances into optimized raster images. Simply add "-x" to the name of any frame, component, or instance you want to include in the conversion. Your originals remain intact and are only hidden during the process - easily restored with a single click. Perfect for preparing slides for PDF export or creating static versions of your designs.


Features include:

  1. One-click conversion of frames, components, and instances to images
  2. Adjustable resolution (1x to 3x)
  3. Automatic size optimization
  4. Easy toggle between original and rasterized versions
  5. Progress tracking for batch processing
  6. Non-destructive workflow (originals preserved)


Disclaimer: This plugin is provided "as is" without any warranties. The developer is not responsible for any issues that may arise from its use. Users are advised to maintain backups of their work.
plugins.tagline: Convert frames, components, and instances to high-quality raster images with a single click

plugins.name: Pixel Magic
plugins.description:
Transform your images into eye-catching pixel art with Pixel, the ultimate Figma plugin for pixel enthusiasts! Whether you're crafting retro aesthetics or exploring unique design styles, Pixie offers endless possibilities for creativity.


Why Use Pixel Pixie?

  1. Custom Backgrounds: Set your own background color to complement your design perfectly.
  2. Adjustable Precision: Control size for the ideal level of detail in your artwork.
  3. Pixel Shapes: Choose from various pixel shapes (squares, circles, and semi-circle) to customize your pixel art style.
  4. Export Type: Choose to export the pixelated effect as either an image or a group of nodes.


Designed for designers, artists, and creative minds, Pixie lets you reimagine your visuals in stunning pixelated forms. Discover how this versatile plugin can bring a bold new dimension to your designs.


Important Note:

  1. For node based export, the time to export depends based on number of nodes.
  2. It is better to not have huge number of nodes for better performance


Feedback & Support:

I'd love to see what you've created using this plugin! Feel free to tag me or say hi on X/Twitter (@HarshithAshvi). Your feedback and bug reports are always welcome 🙏


Contact:

Email: astroashvi@gmail.com

X/Twitter: https://x.com/HarshithAshvi
plugins.tagline: Images to pixel effect

plugins.name: Radix Colos as figma variables
plugins.description:
Here is the first version of Radix colors as Figma variables. Beta.


Radix Colors - "A gorgeous, accessible color system for user interfaces"


This plugin is a simple way for you to get any of the Radix colors as variables into a variable collection from any of your files.


The plugin allows you to:

  1. add any color to a preferred variable collection
  2. add solid or alpha variants
  3. choose light or dark values for single mode collections
  4. add both light and dark values as modes for multimode collections (Figma paid seat is required for variable modes)
  5. (soon) add a custom color created in radix web ui
  6. set-up a new variable collection with 2 modes
  7. choose your own collection where to put the variables
  8. choose your ow light and dark modes from the collection


INFO: The plugin is functional, but the user guide and error handling are not done yet. I am releasing it as i is for now so everybody can use the current feature set that covers most of the intended feature set


In order for the plugin to function, you need to go to settings and:

  1. select a mode of operation
  2. select or create a variable collection. It can be renamed at any time in the Figma UI
  3. select variable modes where the values will land. (They can also be renamed at any time)


Settings are saved as you select them.

Known bug: When you create a new collection, you need to close and reopen the settings page to reflect the changes, or press the refresh button.


This was mostly developed in coffee shops. I hope you see where i'm going with this... 😆


https://www.buymeacoffee.com/bogris
plugins.tagline: add Radix colors as Figma variables intou your collection

plugins.name: Smart Annotations
plugins.description:
Smart Annotation


This small plugin lets you grab as many frames or elements as you like and generate a nice Annotation next to each, with the width and height constraints of them.


*NEW: Also generate annotations of all the components inside and a link to it.



This Figma plugin is made with lot's of love, and trying to suffice a need I constantly encounter on medium-large projects. Being able to quickly generate links and organise my views or flows in a dedicated project navigation area.

accepted.name: Mojo
accepted.description: Passionate Guy. Always chasing knowledge and best practices. Staff Product Designer at rootstrap.com. Degree in graphic design, Figma Lover, ex-Frontender.

plugins.name: Tuned Variables
plugins.description:
Tuned Variables

A Figma plugin for creating simple mathmatical expressions with local variables


🔥 Features:

  • Create values based on simple mathmatical expressions
  • Use other variables as values for an expression
  • Reference variables from other groups
  • Reference variables from other collections


🚀 How to use:

  1. In a variable, update its description with an expression like so: {{ 2 + 2 }}
  2. In the menu bar, click on the plugin, and it will run through all your variables and update their values if an expression is set.
  3. To use other variables as values reference them like so: {{ $base * 2 }}. This will take the value from the value with the name base
  4. To use nested variables simply use their name: {{ $Font/Size/base * 2}}. This will take the value base from the group Size inside the group Font
  5. To use variables from other collections prepend the variable name with the collection name. Example: If you have a collection called primitives then write it like so $primitives/Font/Size/base - this will get the variable Font/Size/base inside the primitives collection


🚧 Limitations:

Only Number variables at the moment

Modes are isolated, so you can't use a variable value from another mode.

Only simple operators are supported: *, /, +, -


🎁 Contribute:

If you want to improve the plugin, then you are very welcome to create a PR


🤝 License:

This will stay forever free and you are welcome to use this in personal and business use.


💎 Need more advanced featues?

I don't have plans to make this plugin more advanced, so if you need more advanced features i would recommend you to check out the Dynamic Variables by @neelts
plugins.tagline: Reference other variables and create simple calculations for dynamic values

plugins.name: Keywords Generator
plugins.description:
Say goodbye to the daunting task of manually creating keywords for each component. With the AI-powered Keywords Generator plugin, you can instantly generate keywords for all your components.


How it works

Under the hood, the plugin generates a list of keywords that are synonym and closely related to the component title.


How to use

  1. Enter a valid OpenAI API key and click on "Validate Key". If successful, you'll be taken to the logged area.
  2. Select all components you wish to generate keywords for the description field (make sure you select the parent components)
  3. Select the keywords amounts and language
  4. Click on ”Generate Keywords” and wait until you see a success alert displayed


Note

  1. Please bear in mind that this plugin leverages an AI large language model, which may generate unexpected results or hallucinations. Leave a comment if you encounter unexpected outcomes or spot bugs
  2. You'll need an OpenAI API key with credit balance in order to use this plugin. Probably you won't ever use more than $0.10 in credit
  3. The time taken to generate the keywords will vary significantly depending on the amount of components selected


Ideas & Suggestions

This is a very first version and there's a lot to improve. I’d love to hear ideas and feature suggestions to continuously improve this plugin.
plugins.tagline: Instantly generate AI-powered keywords for all your Figma components.

105664.tagline: Instantly generate AI-powered keywords for all your Figma components.

plugins.name: Scaffolder
plugins.description:
Scaffolder sets up the pages that are in a project based on a proven formula for small, large and enterprise design systems. You can choose one of 4 options.


Small Project (Design + Style Hints)

Includes pages for mood board, style hints, designs, research, and components. This type is for small projects that don't need a full style guide.


Large Project (Design + Style Guide)

Includes pages for mood board, page types, style guide, designs, research, and components. This type is for large projects that need a full style guide as well as multiple application modules/areas.


Enterprise Project (Design)

Includes pages for designs and research. This type is for enterprise projects that not only needs a style guide, but also needs to separate the design system, guide, and components from the page designs. This is meant to be used along with the 'Enterprise Project (Theme)' type.


Enterprise Project (Theme)

Includes pages for mood board, page types, style guide, and components. This type is used to build out the style guide, design system, and components that will be used with the 'Enterprise Project (Design)' file.


Note: Once you run the plugin, do not run it again or you might get duplicate pages. It will not remove existing pages except for the initial, default page.
plugins.tagline: Scaffolds project page setup for quick, consistent design file.

73036.name: Scaffolder
73036.description:

Large Project (Design + Style Guide)

Enterprise Project (Design)

Includes pages for designs and research. This type is for enterprise projects that not only needs a style guide, but also needs to separate the design system, guide, and components from the page designs. This is meant to be used along with the 'Enterprise Project (Theme)' type.


Enterprise Project (Theme)

Includes pages for mood board, page types, style guide, and components. This type is used to build out the style guide, design system, and components that will be used with the 'Enterprise Project (Design)' file.


Note: Once you run the plugin, do not run it again or you might get duplicate pages. It will not remove existing pages except for the initial, default page.
73036.tagline: Scaffolds project page setup for quick, consistent design file.

plugins.name: Frame Each Selection
plugins.description: Frame Each Selection automates the tedious process of wrapping multiple elements in individual frames. With customizable padding and naming options, this plugin streamlines your workflow by eliminating repetitive tasks and maintaining design consistency. Perfect for UI designers working with component libraries, design systems, or any project requiring precise organization.

123047.name: Frame Each Selection

plugins.name: ChromaCraft
plugins.description: This Figma plugin allows users to select a single element on the canvas. It analyzes the color of the selected element and determines whether it's a light or dark color. Based on this analysis, it generates a new color that is either darker or lighter and creates a visual representation of this new color beside the selected element. The plugin also takes care of font loading and positioning the new color representation appropriately.

plugins.name: Cloudinary
plugins.description:
Enhance team collaboration, streamline your workflows, and leverage Cloudinary’s powerful media management features for your Figma assets.

The Cloudinary plugin integrates directly within Figma, allowing users to effortlessly insert images from the Cloudinary Media Library and upload images to Figma to share with others.


To get started:

  1. Sign up for a free Cloudinary account.
  2. Install the Cloudinary plugin from this marketplace page.
  3. In Figma, select Cloudinary from the Plugin menu to open the interface and log in.
  4. Choose a layer or artboard, then:
  5. Use the Library tab to insert images from Cloudinary into Figma.
  6. Use the Upload tab to upload images from Figma to Cloudinary.
plugins.tagline: Use Cloudinary images and videos in Figma

130782.name: Cloudinary
130782.description:
Enhance team collaboration, streamline your workflows, and leverage Cloudinary’s powerful media management features for your Figma assets.

The Cloudinary plugin integrates directly within Figma, allowing users to effortlessly insert images from the Cloudinary Media Library and upload images to Figma to share with others.


To get started:

  1. Sign up for a free Cloudinary account.
  2. Install the Cloudinary plugin from this marketplace page.
  3. In Figma, select Cloudinary from the Plugin menu to open the interface and log in.
  4. Choose a layer or artboard, then:
  5. Use the Library tab to insert images from Cloudinary into Figma.
  6. Use the Upload tab to upload images from Figma to Cloudinary.

130782.tagline: Use Cloudinary images and videos in Figma

plugins.name: I18n exporter
plugins.description:
Tabbed JSON Viewer for Figma


Transform your text variables into JSON format required by i18n libraries for language translations directly within Figma!


How It Works

Prepare Your Variables: Ensure your variable collections are correctly named i18n in Figma. This is crucial for the plugin to identify and process the variables meant for internationalization.


Fetch Variables: Click on the Get Variables button to automatically fetch and transform your project's i18n variables into a structured JSON format.


View and Copy: The plugin conveniently displays your variables in a tabbed interface, organized by language. Simply select the desired language tab to view the JSON output. Use the copy button to copy the JSON to your clipboard for easy integration into your i18n workflow.


Clear JSON: Want to start over or clean up? Click Clear JSON to reset the output area.


Features

Easy-to-use Interface: A user-friendly UI with a tabbed display allows for seamless navigation and operation.

Efficient Variable Conversion: Quickly converts your Figma text variables into i18n-compatible JSON.

Flexible Copy Options: Copy individual languages or the entire JSON output with a single click.


Getting Started

To get started, ensure your variable collections within Figma are named i18n. This naming convention is essential for the plugin to recognize and process your text variables for translation. Once set up, click on the Get Variables button to convert and view your variables in JSON format.


Whether you're developing multilingual designs or working on international projects, this plugin simplifies the translation process by seamlessly integrating with your i18n libraries.


Enhance your design workflow and embrace global accessibility with the Tabbed JSON Viewer for Figma.


Note: This plugin is an independent tool designed to facilitate the conversion of text variables to JSON for i18n libraries. It is not an official i18n plugin or affiliated with any official i18n library developers.
plugins.tagline: I18n exporter

83588.name: I18n exporter
83588.description:

View and Copy: The plugin conveniently displays your variables in a tabbed interface, organized by language. Simply select the desired language tab to view the JSON output. Use the copy button to copy the JSON to your clipboard for easy integration into your i18n workflow.


Clear JSON: Want to start over or clean up? Click Clear JSON to reset the output area.

plugins.name: Source DS Utils
plugins.description:
Bunch of utilities for Source Design System and Source Foundation plugin. I feel like these automations can be useful for everyone who designs in Figma.


This is a UI-less plugin that uses Figma quick actions to run automations.


Export component templates

Select components or frames with components and run the command to copy all these components as frames. You can use these copies to import component templates back.


Import component templates

Select a frame with exported component templates and run the command. This command will either replace target component content with the contents of the template or it will merge layers


Fix layers

Sometimes Figma does not resize absolutely positioned layers when you update something rapidly. When you spot such rouge layers went off you can fix them with this automation.


This command finds all absolutely positioned layers inside auto layout frames and snaps their size back to fit the parent.


Create color Styles

This command will create colour styles that are bound to the variables of the same name.


Clone component

Effortlessly clone any component or component set. When you copy/paste a simple component with lots of properties Figma creates a component instance. This automation creates an identical copy with all the properties available.


Make local component

Simplify workflow for slot components. This automation takes the instance inside another component, creates a local copy of that instance, makes it a component and swaps it with that component.


Slot to local component

Simplify workflow for slot components. This automation takes the instance, checks instance swap properties and enables you to swap it with newly created component. Lear more here -> https://forum.figma.com/t/slot-component-workflow-plugin/93749


Update Elevation Components

This is Source Design System specific automation. It reads effect styles and updates custom-made elevation components to match effect shadows.


Set Playground

Mark any file as Source Foundation Playground. This plugin uses figma.root.setPluginData method from plugin API to toggle 'SDSPlayground' property.
plugins.tagline: Automations for Source Design system

113337.name: Source DS Utils
113337.description:
Bunch of utilities for Source Design System and Source Foundation plugin. I feel like these automations can be useful for everyone who designs in Figma.


This is a UI-less plugin that uses Figma quick actions to run automations.

Fix layers

This command finds all absolutely positioned layers inside auto layout frames and snaps their size back to fit the parent.

Clone component

Make local component

plugins.name: DSekon Auto Layout
plugins.description:
The plugin moves the elements to the next line AUTOMATICALLY.


  1.  Launch the plugin. The UI panel opens.
  2. Select a bunch of items.
  3. Use button “+” to create an adaptive auto layout.
  4. Change the frame width.
  5. The elements will be rearranged automatically (The elements will also be rebuilt when the elements inside the frame are changed, except for deletion).


IMPORTANT: To automatically rearranged the elements, the UI panel must be open.


The plugin has the ability to sort the elements inside the frame in alphabetical order.


DSekon.com

Donate
plugins.tagline: The plugin moves the elements to the next line AUTOMATICALLY.

plugins.name: 暗色组件助手 Dark Mode Assistant for Components
plugins.description:
介绍

“暗色组件助手”插件旨在简化在 Figma 组件中管理暗黑模式的过程。通过几次点击，你可以快速启用任何选中组件或实例的暗黑模式，同时如果可用，插件会应用组件库中的暗色 token 设置。


功能说明

  1. 自动检测并启用选中组件和实例的暗黑模式。
  2. 递归检查并更新嵌套在组和框架中的所有组件的暗黑模式。
  3. 允许你将组件库中的“暗色” token 应用于外观模块。
  4. 与具有“componentProperties”和“appearance”模块的组件兼容。


使用方法

  1. 选中你希望应用暗黑模式的组件、组或框架。
  2. 点击插件按钮，插件会自动为所有选中的元素及其子元素启用暗黑模式。
  3. 插件会自动应用暗黑模式设置，并在可用的情况下将其链接到组件库中的“暗色”token。


注意事项

  1. 插件最佳工作效果是在具有属性定义的组件库中使用。
  2. 如果未找到“appearance”模块，插件仍然会启用暗黑模式，但不会应用 token。
  3. 确保你的组件已正确链接到包含暗黑模式 token 的组件库，以获得完整功能。


Introduction

The "Dark Mode Assistant for Components" plugin is designed to streamline the process of managing dark mode properties in Figma components. With just a few clicks, you can quickly enable dark mode for any selected component or instance, while also applying the appropriate token settings for dark mode if available.


Function Description

  1. Automatically detects and enables dark mode for selected components and instances.
  2. Recursively checks and updates dark mode for all nested components within groups and frames.
  3. Allows you to apply the "dark" token from your component library's appearance module.
  4. Works seamlessly with components that have "componentProperties" and "appearance" modules.


How to Use

  1. Select the components, groups, or frames that you want to apply dark mode to.
  2. Click the plugin button to enable dark mode for all selected elements and their children.
  3. The plugin will automatically apply the dark mode setting and, if available, link it to the "dark" token in your component library.


Precautions

  1. The plugin works best with components that have properties defined in the component library.
  2. If no "appearance" module is found, the plugin will still enable dark mode but will not apply the token.
  3. Ensure that your components are correctly linked to a component library with dark mode tokens for full functionality.

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: Everything gets a response, but nothing gets a resolution. 事事有回应，事事不答应。

plugins.tagline: Dark Mode Assistant for Components: Easily Toggle Dark Mode

  3. 允许你将组件库中的“暗色” token 应用于外观模块。
  4. 与具有“componentProperties”和“appearance”模块的组件兼容。


使用方法

  2. 点击插件按钮，插件会自动为所有选中的元素及其子元素启用暗黑模式。
  3. 插件会自动应用暗黑模式设置，并在可用的情况下将其链接到组件库中的“暗色”token。


注意事项

  1. 插件最佳工作效果是在具有属性定义的组件库中使用。
  2. 如果未找到“appearance”模块，插件仍然会启用暗黑模式，但不会应用 token。
  3. 确保你的组件已正确链接到包含暗黑模式 token 的组件库，以获得完整功能。


Introduction

The "Dark Mode Assistant for Components" plugin is designed to streamline the process of managing dark mode properties in Figma components. With just a few clicks, you can quickly enable dark mode for any selected component or instance, while also applying the appropriate token settings for dark mode if available.


Function Description

  1. Automatically detects and enables dark mode for selected components and instances.
  2. Recursively checks and updates dark mode for all nested components within groups and frames.
  3. Allows you to apply the "dark" token from your component library's appearance module.
  4. Works seamlessly with components that have "componentProperties" and "appearance" modules.


How to Use

  1. Select the components, groups, or frames that you want to apply dark mode to.
  2. Click the plugin button to enable dark mode for all selected elements and their children.
  3. The plugin will automatically apply the dark mode setting and, if available, link it to the "dark" token in your component library.


Precautions

  1. The plugin works best with components that have properties defined in the component library.
  2. If no "appearance" module is found, the plugin will still enable dark mode but will not apply the token.
  3. Ensure that your components are correctly linked to a component library with dark mode tokens for full functionality.

manifest.name: 暗色组件助手 Dark Mode Assistant for Components

136390.release_notes: Update the cover and add a usage demo video
136390.tagline: Dark Mode Assistant for Components: Easily Toggle Dark Mode

plugins.name: Button States Generator
plugins.description:
Enhance your design workflow with the Button States Generator and create consistent, accessible button components effortlessly.


Overview


The Button States Generator is a Figma plugin designed to streamline the creation of button components with multiple states: Default, Hover, Active, Focus, Selected, and Disabled.


Features


- Dynamic Button Creation: Generate button components with customizable dimensions, radius, paddings & colors

- State Variants: Automatically create and manage button states including Default, Hover, Active, Focus, Selected, and Disabled.

- Color Customization: Easily adjust each state colors, with options to randomize or reset to default.

- Contrast Checker: Built-in contrast checker ensures your design meets WCAG standards for accessibility.

- Icon Placement Options: Choose from multiple icon placement options (none, left, right, or icon-only) as a component property.


How to Use


Assuming you already have your button design ready:


1. Select button Frame: Start by selecting the frame of your button.

2. Customize Settings (optional): Use the plugin's UI to adjust dimensions, colors, and other settings if necessary.

3. Choose Icon Placement (optional): Select the icon placement option from the dropdown menu (none, left, right, or icon-only).

4. Generate Components: Click 'Create Component' to generate the button variants.


Note: This will not work if you select a pre-existing component. If your button is a component, detach it to convert it into a Frame.


Component Properties


The generated button component includes these useful properties:


- States: Choose between Default, Hover, Focus, Selected, and Disabled states

- Icon: Control icon placement (None, Left, Right, Only)

- Colors: Adjust text and background colors for each state

- Dimensions: Fine-tune sizing, radius and padding


Support


For any questions or support, please contact luc.hespel@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Generate Button component with variants / states instantly

plugins.name: Convert to ICO
plugins.description:
Convert to Ico is a simple yet powerful Figma plugin that helps designers and developers easily transform any Figma element into Windows ICO icon files.


Key Features:

• Convert any Frame, Group, or Image to ICO format

• Multiple preset size options (16px, 32px, 48px, 64px, 128px)

• Real-time preview functionality

• Clean and intuitive interface

• Quick one-click export


Whether you're designing Windows application icons, website favicons, or working on any project that requires ICO format, Convert to Ico streamlines your workflow with its efficient conversion process.
plugins.tagline: Convert any Figma design to ICO icons in one click

plugins.name: Multiple Font Replacer by Plantcss
plugins.description:
Multiple Font Replacer By Plantcss:


Changing the font family and style, as well as the entire document and selected text layers, is simple.


Demo Video:

https://youtu.be/sBFZnvp_waQ


Features:

Missing Font Replacer

Replace missing fonts only selection layer

At the same time, change the font family and style in multiple locations.

To change the entire page styles



How to apply:

The plugin can be used for free for one week, after which it must be purchased.


To successfully change the font, first pick the text layers for the document, then click the old font, select the new font, and last click the replace button.

plugins.name: Nested Instances
plugins.description:
This tool shows you any instances within the current selection.

Why is the useful? If you have a lot of similar layers with nested instances it's not easy to update them all simultaneously. Figmas new select similar tool solves some of these problems but this plugin is a lot more explicit with it's functionality.


In addition to instances, this also shows any layers with the same name in the current selection which can be useful for editing similar layers.
plugins.tagline: See and select any nested instances within the current selection

plugins.name: Figma to PostGrid
plugins.description:
Figma to PostGrid


The Figma to PostGrid Plugin is built for designers and developers, letting you easily export your Figma designs into ready-to-use PostGrid templates. This means you can leverage the power of Figma's design tools to create stunning and personalized direct mail pieces, all without leaving Figma.


What can you do with the Plugin?


  1. Works great with how you already design: No need to make major shifts within your systems, tools and tech stacks, the plugin works seamlessly with your existing design workflow!
  2. One-click export: Export your beautiful designs directly into PostGrid with just a few clicks.
  3. Make it yours: Use merge variables to add personalized information to each piece of mail, making it unique.
  4. Ditch the PDFs: Forget about static PDFs and create mailers that are more engaging and interactive.


How to get started


  1. Open the plugin in your Figma workspace.
  2. Sign in using your PostGrid account credentials or add the test/live API key.
  3. Click on "Create Template" to add the supported template and create the collateral from scratch.
  4. Click on "Export Template" once you are ready with the collateral design.


Access the detailed guide to help you get started.


Reach out to support@postgrid.com if you have any questions or issues.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly convert Figma designs into dynamic PostGrid direct mail templates.

  1. Works great with how you already design: No need to make major shifts within your systems, tools and tech stacks, the plugin works seamlessly with your existing design workflow!
  2. One-click export: Export your beautiful designs directly into PostGrid with just a few clicks.
  3. Make it yours: Use merge variables to add personalized information to each piece of mail, making it unique.
  4. Ditch the PDFs: Forget about static PDFs and create mailers that are more engaging and interactive.


How to get started


  1. Open the plugin in your Figma workspace.
  2. Sign in using your PostGrid account credentials or add the test/live API key.
  3. Click on "Create Template" to add the supported template and create the collateral from scratch.
  4. Click on "Export Template" once you are ready with the collateral design.


Access the detailed guide to help you get started.


Reach out to support@postgrid.com if you have any questions or issues.

132941.tagline: Effortlessly convert Figma designs into dynamic PostGrid direct mail templates.

plugins.name: TokenKebab Converter
plugins.description:
Purpose

This Figma plugin is designed to facilitate a smoother transition between design and development stages, particularly for those utilizing the Tokens Studio and EightShapes in their design system workflow.

Key Functionality

  • Typography Token Transformation:
  • Converts typography tokens defined in dot notation (e.g., typography.Body.Bold) into an appropriate Sass mixin structure (e.g., @include fontStyle(body-bold);).
  • Kebab-Case Conversion:
  • Transforms tokens, including those related to spacing (e.g., spacing.150), into a kebab-case format, ensuring consistency and CSS-friendly naming conventions (e.g., spacing-150).
  • Theme Prefixing:
  • Automatically prefixes theme-related tokens with "light-", changing, for instance, theme.input.border.default to light-theme-input-border-default.

In essence, the plugin programmatically refactors design tokens, enhancing their usability and implementability in CSS/Sass codebases, and ensuring a coherent and systematic naming convention throughout the design-to-development handoff process.
plugins.tagline: Ensuring Consistency from Design Tokens to Implementation

plugins.name: De-annotator

plugins.name: Spacing Manager
plugins.description:
Spacing Manager is a powerful yet intuitive plugin for Figma designed to help you efficiently find and update spacing values in your designs. Whether you want to align elements to your design system variables or apply custom spacing, Spacing Manager streamlines the process, saving you time and ensuring consistency across your projects.


✨ Key Features:

🔍 Quickly search for elements with specific spacing values.

📏 Replace spacing values with predefined design system variables or custom values.

🌙 Interactive UI with smooth dark mode and gradient accents for an enhanced user experience.

🚀 Seamless integration with your Figma projects, no setup required.


Take control of your design system spacing and ensure pixel-perfect alignment with Spacing Manager
plugins.tagline: Simplify and standardize your spacing with easy
